ground_truth: Isaac stops for a security scan, and inside the opulent suite, he sits opposite a Saudi prince who holds an electronic document and wears a pair of sunglasses, with the tech reflected in them, before removing them. Meanwhile, a group of workers roll a storage crate through a darkened exhibition hall, opening it to reveal a replica of Leonardo da Vinci's Mona Lisa which they use to replace the original. A man shines a torch on the hanging replica, highlighting Mona Lisa's mouth. A TV broadcast shows a Mayan temple as Jackson, a handsome, dark-haired man in his 30s, leaps off his couch, rushes into his bathroom to clean his teeth, answers the phone on his way out, silently curses his car, and walks out of the garage. He gets into a stretch limo with dark windows and drives off past the surface, noticing a jagged crack in the road as kids jump over it. Jackson arrives at his ex-wife Kay's house, while in San Francisco Harbor, people on a ship list up and down dramatically. As passengers stumble when the boat's hull crunches into the docks, ship stewards help them up while Harry and his friend Terry scan the area, frowning. Laura wakes up in bed, answers her phone, and in another location, Roland is driving when the back of his car explodes, flipping it forward and engulfing it in flames. Jackson's limo rounds a corner on the way to Yellowstone National Park. Inside the Oval Office, Wilson looks across at Anheuser as Laura enters with a newspaper featuring a story about Roland's death. She turns on the TV, ignoring Adrian, while Wilson eyes Anheuser who gets up to leave, and Adrienne follows before sitting heavily on a sofa. President Wilson sits in front of her, putting his hand over hers. At Yellowstone Park, Jackson drops his daughter Lily's hat over a fence and climbs after it, followed by Lily and her brother Noah along a sparse trail to a clearing with a parched lake basin. They head down to the cordoned-off, bubbly, marshy basin surrounded by big tripods, and approach a dead, rotting stag. Someone amongst the trees on a hillside watches them through binoculars, with steam rising from the lake bed around Jackson as he takes his kids' hands and a convoy arrives in front of him. The watcher in the trees is a man named Charlie Frost.

Inside the Oval Office, Wilson gazes across at Anheuser as Laura enters with a newspaper showcasing a story about Roland's demise. President Wilson sits in front of her, placing his hand over hers. At Yellowstone Park, Jackson drops his daughter Lily's cap over a fence and climbs after it, followed by Lily and her sibling Noah along a sparse trail to a clearing with a parched lake basin. They head down to the cordoned-off, bubbly, marshy basin surrounded by large tripods, and approach a dead, decaying stag. test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Isaac is stopped for a security scan, and inside the opulent suite, he is seated opposite a Saudi prince who is holding an electronic document and wearing a pair of sunglasses, with the tech reflected in them, before they are removed by him. Meanwhile, a storage crate is rolled by a group of workers through a darkened exhibition hall, and a replica of Leonardo da Vinci's Mona Lisa is revealed when it is opened by them to replace the original. The hanging replica is highlighted by a man who shines a torch on Mona Lisa's mouth. A Mayan temple is shown by a TV broadcast as Jackson, a handsome, dark-haired man in his 30s, leaps off his couch, rushes into his bathroom to clean his teeth, answers the phone on his way out, silently curses his car, and walks out of the garage. He gets into a stretch limo with dark windows and drives off past the surface, noticing a jagged crack in the road as kids jump over it. Kay's house is arrived at by Jackson, while in San Francisco Harbor, people list up and down dramatically on a ship. As the boat's hull crunches into the docks, causing passengers to stumble, they are helped up by ship stewards while Harry and his friend Terry scan the area, frowning. Laura is woken up in bed, answers her phone, and in another location, Roland drives when the back of his car is exploded, flipping it forward and engulfing it in flames. Jackson's limo is rounded by him on a corner on the way to Yellowstone National Park. Inside the Oval Office, Wilson looks across at Anheuser as Laura enters with a newspaper featuring a story about Roland's death. She turns on the TV, ignoring Adrian, while Wilson eyes Anheuser who gets up to leave, and Adrienne follows before sitting heavily on a sofa. Laura is sat in front of by President Wilson, and he puts his hand over hers. At Yellowstone Park, Lily's hat is dropped by Jackson over a fence and followed by Lily and her brother Noah along a sparse trail to a clearing with a parched lake basin. They head down to the cordoned-off, bubbly, marshy basin surrounded by big tripods, and they approach a dead, rotting stag. Amongst the trees on a hillside, someone watches them through binoculars, with steam rising from the lake bed around Jackson as he takes his kids' hands and a convoy arrives in front of him. Charlie Frost is named as the watcher in the trees.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Isaac undergoes a security scan before sitting in an opulent suite across from a Saudi prince with an electronic document, visible in his sunglasses, which he removes. Meanwhile, workers in a dim exhibition hall replace the Mona Lisa with a replica, highlighted by a torch on the mouth. On TV, a Mayan temple appears as Jackson, a handsome man in his 30s, rushes from his couch to brush his teeth, answers a call, curses his car, and exits the garage. He hops into a stretch limo, driving past a road crack with jumping kids. Jackson arrives at his ex-wife Kay's home, and in San Francisco Harbor, a ship's dramatic movement makes passengers stumble as stewards assist, while Harry and Terry frown. Laura wakes up and answers her phone, and elsewhere, Roland's car explodes violently. Jackson's limo heads to Yellowstone National Park. In the Oval Office, Wilson looks at Anheuser as Laura enters with a newspaper about Roland's death. She turns on the TV, ignoring Adrian, while Wilson observes Anheuser leaving and Adrienne sitting on a sofa. President Wilson holds her hand supportively. At Yellowstone Park, Jackson retrieves his daughter Lily's hat, joined by Lily and Noah on a trail to a dry lake basin. They approach a marshy, cordoned area with a stag's carcass, as Charlie Frost watches through binoculars amid rising steam. Jackson takes his kids' hands, and a convoy arrives.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Isaac undergoes a security scan and meets a Saudi prince with an electronic document, sunglasses reflecting the tech, which he removes. Workers roll a crate through a dim exhibition hall, revealing a Mona Lisa replica to swap with the original. A man highlights the replica's mouth with a torch. A TV shows a Mayan temple as Jackson, a handsome 30-something, jumps up, brushes his teeth, answers a call, curses his car, and exits the garage. He enters a dark-windowed limo, noticing a road crack as kids jump over it. Jackson stops at ex-wife Kay's house. In San Francisco Harbor, ship passengers stumble when the boat hits the dock as stewards assist, while Harry and Terry scan the area. Laura wakes in bed, answers her phone, and elsewhere Roland's car explodes. Jackson's limo heads to Yellowstone. In the Oval Office, Wilson looks at Anheuser as Laura enters with news of Roland's death, turns on the TV, and ignores Adrian. Wilson comforts Adrienne. At Yellowstone, Jackson retrieves daughter Lily's hat, followed by his kids to a marshy basin, finding a dead stag. Charlie Frost watches them from the trees with steam rising, and a convoy arrives.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Before entering the opulent and luxurious suite, Isaac comes to a halt for a mandatory security scan. Once inside, he positions himself directly across from a Saudi prince. The prince, holding an electronic document in his hands, wears a sleek pair of reflective sunglasses, through which the glint of the digital screen is visible. After a moment, he removes the sunglasses. Meanwhile, in a dimly lit exhibition hall, a team of workers goes about their task, rolling a storage crate carefully across the floor. Upon opening it, they reveal a precisely crafted replica of Leonardo da Vinci’s famous painting, the Mona Lisa. This deft creation is used to replace the original masterpiece. One man shines a bright torchlight on the hanging replica, specifically illuminating the enigmatic smile of Mona Lisa. Elsewhere, a television broadcast displays the grand image of a Mayan temple as Jackson—a handsome man in his 30s with dark hair—suddenly jumps from his couch. He quickly rushes into his bathroom, multitasking by cleaning his teeth, then answers the phone in a flurry as he heads out. He silently curses as he passes his car on his way into the garage, and then he climbs into a stretch limousine with darkly tinted windows, driving off. As he navigates past the street, he notices a severe, jagged crack in the road where children leap over it with carefree abandon. 

Jackson arrives at the house of his ex-wife, Kay, while at the same time, in the bustling San Francisco Harbor, the scene shifts to people aboard a ship rocked by sudden movement, tilting them up and down dramatically. As the boat's hull unexpectedly crashes into the docks, the passengers stumble and lose their balance. Ever-alert ship stewards spring into action, helping them back onto their feet. Nearby, Harry and his friend Terry survey the chaotic area, both frowned in concern. Elsewhere, Laura is waking up in her bed. She answers her phone groggily, while at a different location, Roland is on the road, driving when calamity strikes—a catastrophic explosion rips through the back of his car, sending it flipping violently forward as it becomes engulfed in flames. 

Meanwhile, Jackson’s limousine rounds a corner, speeding towards Yellowstone National Park. Inside the prestigious Oval Office, President Wilson directs his gaze across the room at Anheuser. Laura enters, holding a newspaper that prominently features a story about Roland's tragic death. She switches on the television, purposely ignoring Adrian, while Wilson continues to scrutinize Anheuser, who abruptly stands to leave, with Adrienne following him before collapsing heavily onto a sofa. President Wilson positions himself in front of her, reaching out to place his hand comfortingly over hers. At the expansive Yellowstone Park, Jackson is on a trail when his daughter Lily accidentally drops her hat over a fence. Determined, he climbs after it with Lily and her brother Noah following him down a sparse trail leading to a clearing. They arrive at the edge of a dry lake basin, now parched and cracked. They make their way down to the restricted, bubbling, marsh-like basin surrounded by towering tripods, eventually approaching the grim sight of a dead, decaying stag. Hidden amongst the trees on a hillside, an observer watches them intently through binoculars. Steam rises ominously from the lake bed surrounding Jackson as he takes his children’s hands, just as a convoy arrives and stops in front of him. The man observing them from the trees is Charlie Frost.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Before stepping into the opulent and luxurious suite, Isaac comes to a complete halt for an obligatory and thorough security scan. Once he is permitted entrance inside, he carefully positions himself directly across from a Saudi prince. The prince, who is holding an electronic document in his hands, wears a sleek and stylish pair of reflective sunglasses. Through the lenses, one can see the glint of the digital screen reflected. After a brief moment, he deliberately removes the sunglasses. Meanwhile, in a dimly lit exhibition hall, a team of industrious workers is busy with their task, meticulously rolling a large storage crate across the floor. Upon opening it, they unveil a precisely and expertly crafted replica of Leonardo da Vinci’s renowned painting, the Mona Lisa. This skillful creation is intended to take the place of the original masterpiece. One of the men shines a bright torchlight on the hanging replica, specifically illuminating the enigmatic smile of Mona Lisa’s face. 

Elsewhere, a television broadcast showcases the grand and majestic image of a Mayan temple as Jackson—a strikingly handsome man in his 30s with dark hair—suddenly leaps up from his couch. He quickly dashes into his bathroom, multitasking by vigorously cleaning his teeth, then swiftly answers the phone in a flurry as he heads out the door. He silently curses under his breath as he passes his car on his way into the garage, and then he climbs into a stretch limousine with darkly tinted windows, which drives off. As the limousine navigates past the street, he notices a severe, jagged crack in the road, where carefree children leap over it with reckless abandon. 

Jackson eventually arrives at the house of his ex-wife, Kay, while at the same time, in the bustling San Francisco Harbor, the scene shifts to people aboard a ship rocked by sudden movement, tilting them violently up and down. As the boat's hull unexpectedly crashes into the docks, the passengers stumble and lose their balance, teetering precariously. Ever-alert ship stewards quickly spring into action, diligently helping them back onto their feet. Nearby, Harry and his friend Terry survey the chaotic area, each frowning with concern. Elsewhere, Laura is just waking up in her bed. She answers her phone groggily, while at a different location, Roland is on the road, driving when calamity strikes—a catastrophic explosion suddenly rips through the back of his car, sending it flipping violently forward as it becomes engulfed in flames. 

Meanwhile, Jackson’s limousine rounds a corner at high speed, heading towards Yellowstone National Park. Inside the prestigious Oval Office, President Wilson directs his steady gaze across the room at Anheuser. Laura enters the room, holding a newspaper that prominently features a story about Roland's tragic death. She switches on the television, purposely ignoring Adrian, while President Wilson continues to scrutinize Anheuser, who abruptly stands to leave, with Adrienne following him before collapsing heavily onto a nearby sofa. President Wilson positions himself calmly in front of her, reaching out to place his hand comfortingly over hers. At the expansive Yellowstone Park, Jackson is walking on a trail when his young daughter Lily accidentally drops her hat over a fence. Determined, he climbs after it, with Lily and her brother Noah following his lead down a sparse trail leading to a clearing. They eventually arrive at the edge of a dry lake basin, now parched and cracked. They make their way carefully down to the restricted, bubbling, marsh-like basin, surrounded by towering tripods, eventually approaching the grim sight of a dead, decaying stag. Hidden amongst the trees on a nearby hillside, an observer intently watches them through binoculars. Steam ominously rises from the lake bed surrounding Jackson as he takes his children’s hands, just as a convoy arrives and comes to a stop in front of him. The man observing them from the trees is Charlie Frost.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Isaac comes to a halt for a security scan, during which every detail and motion is meticulously checked before he is granted access to the opulent suite. Once inside, he methodically makes his way to a luxurious chair opposite a Saudi prince. The prince, holding an electronic document, exhibits a composed demeanor while wearing a pair of sunglasses, inside the lenses of which the tech is subtly reflected. The prince then thoughtfully removes his sunglasses. Meanwhile, elsewhere, a group of workers collectively exerts effort to roll a large storage crate through the dimly lit exhibition hall. With careful precision, they open the crate to unveil a convincing replica of Leonardo da Vinci's Mona Lisa. Coordinating together, they efficiently manage to replace the original painting with the replica. A focused man then directs a torch's beam onto the replica, skillfully highlighting the Mona Lisa's enigmatic mouth. In another scene, a TV broadcast showcases the majestic structure of a Mayan temple, a visual that prompts Jackson, a strikingly handsome, dark-haired man in his 30s, to leap energetically off his couch. With urgency, he rushes into his bathroom, vigorously scrubbing his teeth, all the while multitasking as the phone rings. He answers it mid-stride, and as he silently curses his seemingly troublesome car, he briskly walks out of the garage. With determination, he climbs into a stretch limo with dark tinted windows and smoothly drives away, attentive enough to notice a jagged crack marring the road's surface where children are exuberantly jumping over it. Jackson's journey brings him to his ex-wife Kay's house, while, in parallel, at San Francisco Harbor, passengers on a ship are forced to adjust as the vessel lists dramatically up and down. During this commotion, the ship's hull makes a resounding crunch against the docks, causing passengers to stumble, and the diligent ship stewards promptly offer assistance to help them regain their balance. Meanwhile, Harry and his friend Terry focus intently on their surroundings, scanning with concerned expressions. In a different setting, Laura awakens slowly in bed and reaches over to answer her ringing phone. Concurrently, in a separate locale, Roland is in the midst of driving when suddenly, a catastrophic explosion occurs at the car's rear, violently flipping it forward and engulfing it in flames. Back with Jackson, his limo expertly rounds a corner en route to Yellowstone National Park. Inside the Oval Office, President Wilson gazes across at Anheuser as Laura enters carrying a newspaper featuring a headline about Roland's untimely death. She switches on the TV without acknowledging Adrian's presence, causing Wilson to shift his gaze towards Anheuser, who then rises to leave. Adrian chooses to follow but later sinks heavily onto a sofa, feeling the weight of the situation. President Wilson then gently places his hand over hers in a gesture of comfort. Meanwhile, at Yellowstone Park, Jackson accidentally drops his young daughter Lily's hat over a fence, prompting him to climb over after it. Lily and her brother Noah eagerly follow him along a sparse trail that leads them to an open clearing, revealing a parched lake basin. The group cautiously approaches the cordoned-off, bubbly, marshy basin, which is surrounded by imposing tripods, and they are taken aback by the sight of a dead, rotting stag. As they take in this unsettling scene, someone discreetly hidden amongst the trees on a hillside observes them intently through binoculars. The observer, identified as a man named Charlie Frost, watches as steam ominously rises from the lake bed around Jackson, who firmly holds his children's hands as a convoy arrives purposefully in front of them.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Isaac undergoes a security scan before entering a luxurious suite to meet with a Saudi prince, who reviews an electronic document, reflected in his sunglasses, before removing them. Concurrently, workers in a dark exhibition hall replace the original Mona Lisa with a replica from a storage crate, while a man highlights the painting's mouth with a torch. On TV, a Mayan temple is featured as Jackson, a handsome man in his 30s, excitedly leaves his couch, brushes his teeth, answers the phone, and curses his car before driving off in a stretch limo. He passes by a road crack, observing kids jumping over it. 

Jackson arrives at his ex-wife Kay's house while in San Francisco Harbor, ship passengers stumble as the vessel crashes into the docks, assisted by stewards, as Harry and Terry survey the scene with concern. Laura awakens to answer a call, and elsewhere, Roland's car explodes, flipping and burning. Jackson's limo heads to Yellowstone National Park, and in the Oval Office, Wilson notices Anheuser's reaction to Laura bringing news of Roland's death. Laura turns on the TV, ignoring Adrian, while Anheuser exits and Adrienne slumps onto a sofa. President Wilson sits beside her, offering comfort. 

At Yellowstone, Jackson retrieves his daughter Lily's hat, leading Lily and her brother Noah along a path to a dry lake basin. They investigate a marshy, bubbling area with a rotting stag, observed by Charlie Frost from the trees as a convoy arrives, with steam rising around them as Jackson takes his kids' hands.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Isaac stops for a security scan, a standard procedure in high-security buildings, and inside the opulent suite in a Riyadh hotel, he sits opposite a Saudi prince, one of the many members of the wealthy House of Saud, who holds an electronic document likely containing sensitive information and wears a pair of sunglasses by a luxury brand, with the tech reflected in them, before removing them. Meanwhile, a group of workers, part of an elaborate art heist, roll a storage crate through a dimly lit exhibition hall, opening it to reveal a meticulously crafted replica of Leonardo da Vinci's Mona Lisa, one of the most famous paintings housed in the Louvre, which they use to replace the original. A man shines a torch on the hanging replica, highlighting Mona Lisa's enigmatic smile, famously known as "La Gioconda." A TV broadcast shows a Mayan temple, possibly the iconic Chichen Itza, as Jackson, a handsome, dark-haired man in his 30s with a reputation for charm, leaps off his couch, rushes into his bathroom to clean his teeth with practiced efficiency, answers the phone on his way out, silently curses his unreliable car, and walks out of the garage. He gets into a stretch limo with dark windows for privacy and drives off past the surface, noticing a jagged crack in the road, a result of recent seismic activity, as kids jump over it, making a game of the disruption. Jackson arrives at his ex-wife Kay's house, located in a quiet suburban neighborhood, while in San Francisco Harbor, known for its bustling activity, people on a ship list up and down dramatically due to choppy waters. As passengers stumble when the boat's hull crunches into the docks, ship stewards, trained to handle such situations, help them up while Harry and his friend Terry scan the area, frowning at the unexpected incident. Laura wakes up in bed, answers her phone with a groggy voice, and in another location, Roland is driving when the back of his car, a classic model known for its durability, explodes, flipping it forward and engulfing it in flames in a sudden, explosive accident. Jackson's limo rounds a corner on the way to Yellowstone National Park, a famous natural reserve known for its geothermal features. Inside the Oval Office at the White House, Wilson looks across at Anheuser, a seasoned political advisor, as Laura enters with a newspaper featuring a story about Roland's death, a headline already causing a stir among officials. She turns on the TV, ignoring Adrian, a colleague hoping for her attention, while Wilson eyes Anheuser who gets up to leave, and Adrienne follows before sitting heavily on a sofa, overwhelmed by the day's events. President Wilson sits in front of her, putting his hand over hers in a reassuring gesture. At Yellowstone Park, Jackson drops his daughter Lily's hat over a fence, an oversight that prompts a playful chase, and climbs after it, followed by Lily and her brother Noah along a sparse trail to a clearing with a parched lake basin, which appears altered by the ongoing drought. They head down to the cordoned-off, bubbly, marshy basin, known for volcanic activity, surrounded by big tripods used for scientific monitoring, and approach a dead, rotting stag, likely a victim of the harsh conditions. Someone amongst the trees on a hillside watches them through binoculars, with steam rising from the lake bed around Jackson as he takes his kids' hands and a convoy of park rangers arrives in front of him. The watcher in the trees is a man named Charlie Frost, a conspiracy theorist known for his eccentric views on natural disasters.

Meanwhile a group of workers roll a storage crate through a darkened exhibition hall opening it to reveal a replica of Leonardo da Vinci's Mona Lisa which they use to replace the original. A man shines a torch on the hanging replica highlighting Mona Lisa's mouth. A TV broadcast shows a Mayan temple. as Jackson a handsome darkhaired man in his 30s leaps off his couch rushes into his bathroom to clean his teeth answers the phone on his way out silently curses his car and walks out of the garage. At Yellowstone Park Jackson drops his daughter Lily's hat over a fence and climbs after it followed by Lily and her brother Noah along a sparse trail to a clearing with a parched lake basin. They head down to the cordonedoff bubbly marshy basin surrounded by big tripods and approach a dead rotting stag. Someone amongst the trees on a hillside watches them through binoculars with steam rising from the lake bed around Jackson as he takes his kids' hands and a convoy arrives in front of him. The watcher in the trees is a man named Charlie Frost.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Isaac stops for a security scan and inside the opulent suite he sits opposite a Saudi prince who holds an electronic document and wears a pair of sunglasses with the tech reflected in them before removing them. Meanwhile a group of workers roll a storage crate through a darkened exhibition hall opening it to reveal a replica of Leonardo da Vinci's Mona Lisa which they use to replace the original. Someone amongst the trees on a hillside watches them through binoculars with steam rising from the lake bed around Jackson as he takes his kids' hands and a convoy arrives in front of him. The watcher in the trees is a man named Charlie Frost.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Benny hesitates for a health check, and inside the rustic cabin, he lounges across from an Irish king who wields a vintage map and wears a pair of spectacles, with the scenery mirrored in them, before discarding them. Meanwhile, a band of chefs slide a pastry cart through a dimmed library, unlocking it to reveal a sculpture of Michelangelo’s David which they utilize to swap with the duplicate. A woman flickers a lantern on the suspended sculpture, accentuating David’s hands. A radio broadcast highlights an Egyptian pyramid as Walter, a charming, blonde-haired woman in her 40s, tumbles off her recliner, sprints into her kitchen to wash her hands, answers the bell on her way in, silently mocks her bicycle, and strolls out of the workshop. She hops onto a tandem bike with clear basket and pedals away past the field, observing a deep crater in the path as ducks waddle over it. Walter reaches her ex-husband Dan's apartment, while in New York Bay, tourists on a raft sway left and right gently. As boaters trip when the craft’s side scrapes against the piers, porters lift them while Mary and her cousin Jerry survey the vicinity, grinning. Paula dozes off in a hammock, answers her pager, and in a separate town, Martin is bicycling when the rear of his van detonates, turning it around and showering it in confetti. Walter’s bike rounds a bend on the way to Grand Canyon Park. Inside a meeting room, Henry glances across at Miller as Paula arrives with a magazine featuring an article about Martin’s accident. She switches on the radio, dismissing Arthur, while Henry observes Miller who rises to depart, and Arthur trails behind before collapsing onto a bench. Governor Henry stands next to her, placing his foot beside hers. At Grand Canyon Park, Walter tosses her son Jack's scarf over a barrier and scrambles after it, trailed by Jack and his cousin Mia along a crowded path to an overlook with an arid river bed. They venture down to the fenced-off, steamy, muddy puddle surrounded by tall cranes, and approach a live, chirping frog. Somebody amongst the branches on a hill observes them through opera glasses, with fog rising from the river bed around Walter as she grasps her children’s shoulders and a parade arrives behind her. The observer in the branches is a woman named Gina Frost.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Isaac undergoes a security scan and sits with a Saudi prince in an opulent suite, who holds and removes sunglasses while reviewing an electronic document. Elsewhere, workers swap the original Mona Lisa with a replica in a dark exhibition hall. Meanwhile, Jackson, a handsome man in his 30s, notices a road crack as he drives in a stretch limo. He stops by his ex-wife Kay's house. In San Francisco Harbor, people struggle on a ship as stewards assist; Harry and Terry scan the area, concerned. Laura wakes up and answers her phone while Roland's car explodes, leading to his death. In the Oval Office, President Wilson interacts with Anheuser and Laura, who presents news of Roland's death. At Yellowstone, Jackson retrieves his daughter Lily's hat as he, Lily, and Noah walk through a parched lake basin. They approach a dead stag, while someone named Charlie Frost watches them through binoculars.
